data.title: Fibonacci multiplied characters
data.solution:
def fib(n):
    res = [1, 1]
    
    while (len(res)<n):
        s = res[-2] + res[-1]
        res.append(s)
      
    return res
   
n = int(input())
ch = input()
f = fib(n)
for x in f:
    print(ch*x)
data.statement:
The fibonacci sequence is an infinite sequence with starts with two 1's.  In continuation, the sum of the last two numbers of the sequence will give the next number in the sequence. 

The first 8 elements of the fibonacci sequence are:
1, 1, 2, 3, 5, 8, 13, 21

Your task is to compute a list of the first [[N]] numbers of the fibonacci sequence and use it to mask a string.

data.stubGenerator:
read N:int
read ch:string(1)

loop N write fibonacci masked output
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> [[N]] Number of fibonacci numbers to calculate
<<Line 2:>> [[ch]] A single character
data.outputDescription: <<Next [[N]] lines:>> A word only using the character [[ch]], which is repeated as often as the fibonacci number at position [[N]].

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

The fibonacci sequence is an infinite sequence with starts with two 1's. In continuation, the sum of the last two numbers of the sequence will give the next number in the sequence.

The first 8 elements of the fibonacci sequence are:
1, 1, 2, 3, 5, 8, 13, 21

Your task is to compute a list of the first N numbers of the fibonacci sequence and use it to mask a string.
Input
Line 1: N Number of fibonacci numbers to calculate
Line 2: ch A single character
Output
Next N lines: A word only using the character ch, which is repeated as often as the fibonacci number at position N.
Constraints
2<=N<=12
Example
Input
3
#
Output
#
#
##
